author: timbeiko
content:
I went ahead and added this to the spec directly: https://github.com/ethereum/eth1.0-specs/blob/master/network-upgrades/mainnet-upgrades/london.md

If client teams have updates, you can open a PR directly against it, or just ping me with what you want added and I'll update the info. Later today or tomorrow I'll try and do some digging to see if I can populate more info myself üëç

author: timbeiko
content:
Also, in <#749160974506000444> and other channels, there has been a lot of talk about making sure that core infrastructure is ready to support London. 
I had three ideas about how to help with this: 

First, bring up the JSON RPC APIs on this week's ACD so we can make sure client teams are prioritizing that. Added to the agenda. 

Second, potentially having a "London Infrastructure" call next week for folks working on tooling to come and share progress/concerns/etc. about London support. 

Third, having an #infrastructure channel for projects to come in and ask questions (given it can be hard to know exactly where to do this, and that we may not want to use <#745077610685661265> for it). 

Thoughts?

author: gcolvin
content:
<@!273808422753796097> <@!211091239112671234> <@!425274498732916736>  The last measurements of computation speed I did (two years ago) are here:
https://github.com/ethereum/evmone/issues/71
This section is probably of most interest:
> Finally we have the time for each arithmetic operation normalized to nanoseconds per unit of gas.  If every opcode were perfectly priced the values for each column of tests for a VM would be the same.  This isn't the case, especially for division and exponentiation.

(ns/gas)| gas| geth| aleth| evmone
--|--|--|--|--
add64| 128000000| 28.02| 4.68| 2.26
add128| 128000000| 32.54| 10.01| 2.75
add256| 128000000| 30.02| 23.50| 2.33
sub64| 128000000| 26.50| 5.45| 4.21
sub128| 128000000| 34.05| 12.06| 4.21
sub256| 128000000| 32.29| 22.07| 4.21
mul64| 384000000| 9.77| 0.78| 2.26
mul128| 384000000| 10.22| 1.32| 2.26
mul256| 384000000| 42.03| 12.43| 2.27
div64| 384000000| 13.54| 9.48| 16.47
div128| 384000000| 20.60| 22.25| 15.68
div256| 384000000| 83.96| 42.12| 17.36
exp| 536870000| 235.64| 81.09| 14.06

author: atoulme
content: Is there a good channel to talk about ops? Looking for a place to talk about hosting Eth clients, uptime challenges, monitoring, etc.

author: timbeiko
content: We are considering opening an #infrastructure channel to have projects talk about readiness for hard forks and whatnot. That feels like it could also be a good fit for it?

author: atoulme
content: that sounds like a good one <@!552133098075193354> yes üôÇ

author: timbeiko
content: Ok, let's open it now then üëç
